result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt A Marking

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kurt A Marking in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Kurt A Marking.  Attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for State of Wisconsin. DE in custody out of county. Parties request PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defn's notice of hearing 8-26-22 returned; hearing date has passed
and returned.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $1,000 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall remain within the curtilage of 1043 Monona Dr at all times except upon preapproval from DCPS for legal and medical appointments.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
DCPS referral

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Kurt A Marking in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Kurt A Marking.  Attorney Patrick Winter for Frank John Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant's motion to amend bond. DE requesting signature bond. Argument. State has no objection to signature bond. Court amends bond to signature bond ($1000). Court adds conditions: DCPS w/ random drug testing, GPS, alcohol testing. Shall remain within the curtilage of 1043 Monona Dr at all times except upon preapproval from DCPS for legal and medical appointments. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Bail/bond hearing on September 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
filed by Atty Idlas
and returned.
9-8-22 bond form emailed to DCJ

CASH BOND AMENDED TO $250.00 PER CASE 
Cash bond is set in the amount of $250 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can arrive at Pretrial Services between the hours of 8 am and 3 pm (Monday through Friday) unless the jail has cleared a later arrival time directly with Pretrial Services. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:06 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Intern Jackie Frank with Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
IN CUSTODY

records.addlTxt: Atty Jacob Idlas
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:30 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
